Monang Saragih Akui Uang Lahan Kesemek Fiktif, dan Keuntungan Nasabah Bukan dari Hasil Usaha
05 Nov 2019, 11:43 by Yedi Supriadi
BANDUNG, (PR).- Terdakwa yang juga Ketua Kopjaskum Monang Saragih tidak bisa mengelak ketika dicecar pertanyaan oleh majelis hakim seputar tidak ada izin, tidak ada kewenangan mengumpulkan uang dan bunga yang terlalu besar. Bahkan Monang Saragih pun mengaku kalau uang bagi hasil yang diberikan ke anggota koperasi bukan dari hasil usaha tapi uang yang diinvestasikan oleh anggota koperasi lain.
"Iya Pak Hakim, uang yang diberikan ke anggota itu bukan dari hasil keuntungan tapi uang dari investor lain," ujar Monang Saragih saat menjawab pertanyaan hakim anggota dalam sidang yang digelar di Pengadilan Negeri Bandung, Selasa 5 November 2019.
Sidang tersebut digelar di ruang utama dengan dipadati pengunjung yang juga merupakan korban investasi bodong Monang Saragih.
Dalam kesempatan tersebut juga terungkap  mengenai lahan jabon dan lahan kesemek saat dipertanyakan majelis hakim ternyata fiktif. 
Awalnya sidang yang dipimpn Toga Napitupulu menggendakan pemeriksaan saksi a de charge (meringankan) dan saksi ahli dari terdakwa. Namun lantaran tidak bisa dihadirkan, sidang dilanjutkan dengan pemeriksaan terdakwa. 
Hakim Ketua Toga membuka pertanyaan soal pendirian Kopjaskum hingga kerjasama dengan PT Rastura untuk penyertaan modal. Monang pun mengaku Kopjaskum menerima keuntungan maksimal 20 persen per tahun dengan PT Rastura. 
"Karena mereka kekurangan modal maka meminta penyertaan modal. Saya kemudian mempublikasikan di radio, ternyata minat anggota banyak, maka diadakan lah investasi penyertaan modal," ujarnya. 
Investasi modal yang dijanjikan Monang, untuk buah kesemek jika anggotanyamenginvestasikan Rp 7,5 juta dalam 3 tahun menjadi Rp 22,5 juta dengan pembayaran per enam bulan. Hakim pun mengaku aneh lantaran keuntungan yang diterima Kopjaskum hanya 20 persen tapi berani menawarkan ke anggota dengan kuntungan di atas 200 persen. 
”Apakah semua pembayaran tahap pertama sudah diberikan," kata hakim.
Monang Saragih pun mengaku baru sebagian dan terpaksa memakai uang kas Kopjaskum dan pribadi, lantaran dari PT Rastura terus memundurkan pembayaran.  Ungkapan dari Monang sekaligus menimbulkan reaksi pengunjung sidan dan menyorakinya serta menyebutkan bohong. 
Selain usaha kesemek, Toga pun kemudian menyakan usaha jabon dan kebenaran lahan tersebut. Monang pun kemudian menjelaskan memiliki lahan ratusan hektare di Sumatera hingga Kalimantan, seperti di Sumatera di Simalungun dia memiliki lahan hingga 100 hektare lebih.
Namun kemudian hakim membacakan surat keterangan Kepala Desa di Simalungun yang menyatakan jika lahan milik Hamonangan hanya sekitar 2 hektare. ”Kata Anda tadi 100 hektare tapi kenyataannya ini cuma dua hektare,” katanya. 
Selain ketua majelis, hakim anggota pun kembali mencecar Monang. Bahkan mengingatkan Monang agar jujur dan terus terang. 
”Jawab dengan jujur, jadi uang yang dibayarkan kepada anggota (bagi hasil) itu uang anggota yang investasi juga kan,” tanya. 
”Sudah jangan bohong lagi, hakim itu gak bisa dibohongi banyak ilmunya. Usaha yang anda tawarkan nggak realistis. Anda saja menerima keuntungan dari kesemek dan jabon Cuma 20 persen, ini menawarkan ke anggota dengan keuntungan lebih dari 200 persen. Ini gak masuk akal, dari mana anda membayarnya jika bukan dari uang investasi anggota,” ujarnya. 
Selain itu usaha investasi yang  terdakwa lakukan juga tidak memiliki izin dari Otoritas Jasa Keuangan (OJK).
Usai melakukan pemeriksaan terdakwa hakim mengundur sidang untuk digelar pada Kamis besok dengan agenda tuntutan.***

Monang Saragih Admits Fictitious Persimmon Land Money, and Customer Benefits Not from Business Results
05 Nov 2019, 11:43 by Yedi Supriadi
BANDUNG, (PR) .- The defendant who is also the Chairman of the Monang Saragih Kopjaskum cannot avoid being questioned by the panel of judges regarding no permit, no authority to collect money and excessive interest. Even Monang Saragih also admitted that the profit-sharing money given to members of the cooperative is not from the results of the business but money invested by other cooperative members.
"Yes, Your Honor, the money given to members is not from profit but money from other investors," said Monang Saragih when answering questions from member judges at a hearing held in Bandung District Court, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
The meeting was held in the main room with visitors who were also victims of Monang Saragih's bulging investment.
On that occasion it was also revealed that Jabon land and persimmon land when questioned by the judges turned out to be fictitious.
Initially the trial led by Toga Napitupulu held an examination of witnesses a de charge (lighten up) and expert witnesses of the defendant. But because it could not be presented, the trial continued with the examination of the defendant.
The Chief Judge of the Toga opened questions about the establishment of the Kopjaskum to the collaboration with PT Rastura for equity participation. Monang also claimed that Kopjaskum received a maximum profit of 20 percent per year with PT Rastura.
"Because they lacked capital, they asked for capital participation. I then published it on the radio. It turned out that there was a lot of member interest, so capital investment was held," he said.
The capital investment promised by Monang, for persimmon if the members invest Rp. 7.5 million in 3 years, becomes Rp. 22.5 million with a payment per six months. The judge also admitted that it was strange because the profit received by Kopjaskum was only 20 percent but dared to offer it to members with a profit of over 200 percent.
"Have all the first stage payments been given," the judge said.
Monang Saragih also admitted that he had only partly been forced to use Kopjaskum and personal cash, because PT Rastura continued to postpone payments. The expression from Monang at the same time caused a reaction from the visitors and cheered him and mentioned the lie.
In addition to persimmon business, Toga also later abandoned Jabon and the truth of the land. Monang then explained that he has hundreds of hectares of land in Sumatra to Kalimantan, like in Sumatra in Simalungun he has more than 100 hectares of land.
But then the judge read out a statement from the Village Head in Simalungun stating that the land owned by Hamonangan was only around 2 hectares. "You said that it was 100 hectares but in reality it was only two hectares," he said.
In addition to the chairman of the panel of judges, member judges also returned to scrutinize Monang. Even reminded Monang to be honest and straightforward.
"Answer honestly, so the money paid to members (profit share) is also money from members who invest, right?" Asked.
"Don't lie anymore, the judge can't be fooled by a lot of his knowledge. The business you offer is not realistic. You just receive benefits from persimmon and Jabon Only 20 percent, this offers to members with a profit of more than 200 percent. This doesn't make sense, where would you pay it if it wasn't from member investment money, "he said.
In addition, the defendant's investment business did not have a permit from the Financial Services Authority (OJK).
After examining the defendant the judge postponed the hearing to be held on Thursday with the agenda of the demands. ***
